intro: Zouchia illyrica, commonly known as the Illyrian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Zouchia illyrica has narrow, linear leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. It is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates.
